description:
Lysinibacillus sphaericus C3-41 is a Gram-positive, spore-forming, rod-shaped bacterium. It belongs to the genus Lysinibacillus, which is a member of the phylum Firmicutes.

Lysinibacillus sphaericus C3-41 is known for its ability to produce insecticidal proteins, particularly the binary toxin, which is effective against mosquito larvae. This makes it a potential biological control agent for mosquito-borne diseases.

The strain C3-41 was isolated from soil samples and has been extensively studied for its insecticidal properties and potential applications in integrated pest management strategies. It is characterized by its ability to form spherical endospores, which contribute to its survival and persistence in the environment.

Ongoing research on Lysinibacillus sphaericus C3-41 focuses on understanding the genetic and molecular mechanisms underlying its insecticidal properties, as well as exploring ways to optimize its efficacy and potential for large-scale production and field applications.
